channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Grayscale urges SEC to approve all Bitcoin ETFs simultaneously
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Grayscale's ETF was previously knocked back by the SEC and it wants it and competing ETFs approved together so none have an advantage.

item.title: Sequoia slashes its crypto fund by 66% after industry collapses: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The $85-billion venture capital firm launched the Sequoia Crypto Fund in February 2022.

item.title: Bitcoin traders put eyes on $31K even as $2B in BTC options expire on Friday
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: BTC traders fix their eyes on $31,000 even as $2 billion in Bitcoin options are set to expire this Friday.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting the Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: SEC chief accountant warns accountants about liabilities when auditing crypto firms
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Paul Munter says making or allowing misleading statements can have serious consequences for accounting firms and individual accountants.

item.title: New Optimism wallet lets users receive crypto via Twitter login
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Beam wallet uses Web3Auth and account abstraction to allow for seedless accounts, stablecoin gas payments and other user experience features.

item.title: Why is Jerome Powell gaslighting us about the odds of recession?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Oliver Rust
item.description: Economic data seems to indicate an economic slowdown is inevitable. So why is Fed Chairman Jerome Powell trying to gaslight Americans?

item.title: Scammers pile on to impersonate Worldcoin on Twitter following token launch
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Twitter announced its rebrand to “X” on July 24, the same day the Worldcoin token launched and provided an opportunity for scammers.

item.title: MakerDAO increases DAI yield in bid to boost demand
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The Enhanced Dai Savings Rate is based on DSR utilization and could boost the stablecoin yield by as much as 8%.

item.title: Optimism transaction volumes surpass Abitrum’s for the first time in six months
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Optimism lost the top spot to Arbitrum in January, after the end of its season one “quest," but has regained it after Worldcoin launched on July 25.

item.title: ‘Pro-crypto bill' passes out of US House Agriculture Committee
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The Republican bill, dubbed FIT for the 21st Century, was drafted by two House committees and passed after strenuous preparations by members of both parties.

item.title: Stablecoins pose lower risk than bank deposits, says ex-Fed policy analyst
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Stablecoins cannot be compared to bank deposits in terms of risk, nor can they be compared to money market funds, argues a new policy paper released by Paradigm.

item.title: Bitcoin price erases FOMC gains as US dollar surges on Q2 GDP print
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin casts off a U.S. GDP “nothingburger,” but DXY charges to two-week highs in what is traditionally a BTC price headwind.

item.title: Rep. Patrick McHenry blames White House for lack of urgency on stablecoin bill negotiations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Republican leadership has blamed the Biden administration for not having a “sense of urgency” on stablecoins, while the Democratic response suggested “impatience” by lawmakers.

item.title: 99-year-old Hungarian artist’s computer-generated NFTs sold for $1.2M
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Vera Molnár pioneered the use of computer-generated art in the latter half of the 20th century.

item.title: Bulls make money, bears make money, pigs get slaughtered
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Guneet Kaur
item.description: Bullish investors profit from rising markets, bearish investors profit from falling markets, while "pigs," often suffer losses in risky conditions.

item.title: Block.one ICO damages ‘far beyond’ $22M, ENF founder says
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Block.one owes much more to EOS investors than just $22 million after the $4-billion ICO, EOS Network Foundation CEO Yves La Rose believes.

item.title: Nexo joins sanctions association as regulatory scrutiny increases
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Nexo looks to keep pace with regulatory requirements by implementing new certification requirements for its compliance team.

item.title: Journeys: Hervé Larren on Bitcoin, Apes and the psychology of ‘blue-chip’ NFTs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elias Ahonen
item.description: Hervé Larren’s crypto journey has taken him from luxury goods to Bitcoin mining and back full circle to the world of “blue-chip” NFTs.

item.title: Bruce Lee avatar to teach martial arts in the metaverse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Those who wish to participate can do so by minting their avatars on the Polygon and Ethereum blockchains.

item.title: NFT-optimized Palm Network to become a Polygon ZK Supernet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The Ethereum sidechain will transition to a proof-of-stake network this August and become a full-fledged layer 2 based on Polygon’s zero-knowledge protocol in 2024.

item.title: Smart contracts continue to rise amid market downturn: BNB Chain Q2 report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: BNB Chain noted that the rise in verified smart contracts highlights the demand for security, reliability and scalability.

item.title: How to use ChatGPT to learn SQL
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Explore practical examples to help you master SQL for database management and data analysis using ChatGPT.

item.title: Hong Kong and Saudi Arabia collaborate on tokens and payments
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The Saudi Central Bank warned in 2019 that Bitcoin is “not recognized by legal entities” but hasn’t made many statements on crypto since.

item.title: German political parties split on how to regulate increasing AI adoption
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Veronika Rinecker
item.description: As the trilogue on the AI Act begins, the European Commission, German politicians, and digital experts express skepticism and make new demands.

item.title: Securitize issues tokenized assets in Spain, plans September trading start
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The U.S.-based trading platform is set to become the first to issue and trade tokenized assets in both the U.S. and the EU, and will operate under the new DLT pilot regime.

item.title: Netflix eyes AI amid Hollywood strike, offers high-paying AI positions
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The positions come with six-figure salaries, ranging from $450,000 to $650,000 for the Technical Director role and $300,000 to $900,000 for the Product Manager position.

item.title: Twitter to X rebrand sparks debate over new name for ‘tweets’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: Amid the new changes to the online social media platform now known as X, users have begun to debate on what to name the iconic posts formerly called tweets.

item.title: Twitter hijacks @X handle, offered user merch, trip to HQ as ‘thank you’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: The Twitter user who initially registered the @X handle had their profile forcibly changed after Elon Musk rebranded the social media platform to X.

item.title: Bitget exec discusses limitations and benefits of CTA AI trading bot
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The bot is the third in a series of AI-trading initiatives launched this year.
